~Skill Training~.Effect:
Become Skilled in any Skill (see Skills).
You can get this Feat multiple times (for different Skills, obviously).
~Skill Training~.Notes: You need at least 2 Base Initiative to get this.
~Skill Training~.Name: ~Skill Training~

~Magic Initiate~.Effect: Choose one more Basic Ability List to gain access to.
~Magic Initiate~.Notes: You can only get this if your Character has Mana.
~Magic Initiate~.Name: ~Magic Initiate~

~Darkvision~.Effect: Your Line of Sight in darkness is 5 meters and your attacks on Units standing in darkness don't have Cover.
~Darkvision~.Name: ~Darkvision~

~Adaptation~.Upgrade: You can get this Feat multiple times.
~Adaptation~.Name: ~Adaptation~

~Old-Fashioned Armsman~.Effect: Your attacks with Weapons that originally have no Stat requirement deal +1 Damage.
~Old-Fashioned Armsman~.Name: ~Old-Fashioned Armsman~

~Double Greatwielding~.Requirement: Trained in 2-Handed melee weapons and at least 2 Might
~Double Greatwielding~.Effect:
You can dual wield 2-Handed melee weapons, one in each hand.
If you make weapon attacks like this, each attack takes only Half-Action and does -5 Damage.
When dual wielding them, if any Ability tells you to perform an attack with a 2-Handed and the ability costs 1 Action, it costs only Half-Action.
~Double Greatwielding~.Notes:
Alternatively, you can wield a Shield in one hand and a 2-Handed melee weapon in the other.
You need Training in Shields to do this.
~Double Greatwielding~.Name: ~Double Greatwielding~

~Highlander Technique~.Effect:
You can wield 1-Handed melee weapons with both hands.
If you do, your 2-Handed weapon attacks with 1-Handed melee weapons take 1 Action and deal an extra +2d6 Damage.
~Highlander Technique~.Name: ~Highlander Technique~

~Improviser~.Effect:
When you make an Improvised Attack, if you're attacking with an object you found in that environment and the object can break, it breaks, and the Damage becomes 1d8 + Might if melee, or 1d6 + Dexterity if ranged.
Additionally, you can pick up objects with 0 Actions.
~Improviser~.Notes: The object must weigh at least 500 grams.
~Improviser~.Name: ~Improviser~

~Tower Shield Training~.Requirement: Trained in Shields, at least 2 Might
~Tower Shield Training~.Effect:
You can wield a Tower Shield.
A Tower Shield gives you a +1 Defense bonus, but reduces your Movement Speed by 2.
~Tower Shield Training~.Notes: Check the Weapons list for the stats of a Tower Shield. Check the Shop to see the price of a Tower Shield.
~Tower Shield Training~.Name: ~Tower Shield Training~

~Shield Dual-Wielding~.Requirements: Trained in Shields, at least 2 Might
~Shield Dual-Wielding~.Effect:
You can wield a Shield in each hand. If you do, you gain an extra +1 Defense, in addition to what the Shield normally gives.
Attacks with a normal Shield now deal 1d6 + ^Might^ Damage (and the Shield counts as a weapon you're Trained in).
~Shield Dual-Wielding~.Upgrade:
If you have Tower Shield Training, you can dual-wield Tower Shields (or a normal Shield and a Tower Shield).
Each Shield gives you its boon, aside from the +1 Defense of this Feat (e.g. Shield + Tower Shield = 50% Pierce Resistance, +1 Defense from the Tower Shield, +1 Defense from this Feat).
~Shield Dual-Wielding~.Name: ~Shield Dual-Wielding~

~Throwing Expert~.Effect: You can throw melee weapons at up to 5 meters range and with their own damage and effects. Thrown 1-Handed Weapons have a -2 Penalty and 2-Handed Weapons a -4 Penalty.
~Throwing Expert~.Name: ~Throwing Expert~

~Blindness~.Effect:
You are blind in your eyes, but can understand your surroundings using your other senses.
You fail all Checks for seeing (or related).
You are immune to being Blinded and take -50% Psychic Damage.
~Blindness~.Name: ~Blindness~

~Deafness~.Effect:
You are deaf in your ears, but can read lips and sense the rest of your surroundings using your other senses.
You fail all Checks for hearing (or related).
You are immune to being Silenced and take -50% Psychic Damage.
~Deafness~.Name: ~Deafness~

~Missing Arm~.Effect:
You are missing an arm or a hand, but make up in accuracy with the other one.
You can't use 2-Handed weapons and Shields.
Every turn, your first Act that deals Damage ignores Cover.
~Missing Arm~.Name: ~Missing Arm~

~Missing Leg~.Effect:
You are missing a leg or a foot, but make up in body movement.
You are immune to being Dazed and take -50% Pulse Damage.
~Missing Leg~.Name: ~Missing Leg~

~Chronic Sickness~.Effect: You gain +1 Charisma if it's below 3.
~Chronic Sickness~.Name: ~Chronic Sickness~

~Vampirism~.Effect: Your Health Regen is always 0. Whenever a Worthy Enemy dies in combat, heal for 10% of its Max Health.
~Vampirism~.Downside: The only way to get this Feat is to have it inflicted upon you by a vampire or curse.
~Vampirism~.Upgrade: Drinking person blood every Adventure (or refusing to) might have unknown effects. The curse progresses...
~Vampirism~.Name: ~Vampirism~

<Battle Enmity>.Effect:
While not in combat, the healing done by Awe increases by 200%.
Awe can no longer trigger while in Combat.
<Battle Enmity>.Name: <Battle Enmity>

~Renounce~.Effect: You renounce your companion, and effectively disable them. Your Max Health increases by 4 and any Life Cleric boons and Talents your companion had (or would have in the future) are transferred to you.
~Renounce~.Name: ~Renounce~

<Desperate Plead>.Effect:
Permanently lose 2 Max Health.
Regain 1 Mana (or use of an Ability if Paladin).
<Desperate Plead>.Name: <Desperate Plead>

<Old Ritual>.Effect: Channel for 10 minutes in a safe space, uninhabited by regular folk. Regain 3 Mana.
<Old Ritual>.Upgrade: If you have this Feat, you can no longer use Shapeshift, whether you used it or not.
<Old Ritual>.Notes: Your Mana can't exceed your Max Mana.
<Old Ritual>.Name: <Old Ritual>

<Lycanthropy>.Effect:
Once per _twilight_ (18:00 to 6:00), you can use Shapeshift to transform into a Lycanthrope until the end of your next turn (see the Lycanthrope form under Pets and Animals).
While a Lycanthrope, you can't willingly shift to another form, and you must Animal Attack with all of your Actions, otherwise you take 5 Damage for each Half-Action spent elsehow.
<Lycanthropy>.Upgrade: Every Worthy _midnight_, if this is not on Cooldown, roll 1d20. If you roll 20, you automatically transform into a Lycanthrope. This rule can be overridden by the QM.
<Lycanthropy>.Notes:
While a Lycanthrope, you have 8 meters Movement Speed, one extra Half-Action per turn (including this), can Break your Movement and Pet Attack heals you for half of the Damage done.
Additionally, you have a base speed of 8 meters, and can use Ominous Howl, which Fears all Units that can hear you for a Half-Action, once per Adventure.
<Lycanthropy>.Name: <Lycanthropy>

<Lone Wolf>.Effect:
You gain +2 Max Health / Level, +2 Health Regen, and +1 to any Stat (this can exceed the maximum value allowed by your Level).
Additionally, you have 2 Mana, which regenerates inbetween Adventures.
<Lone Wolf>.Notes: You no longer have access to the Animal Companion.
<Lone Wolf>.Name: <Lone Wolf>

<Traditionalist>.Effect:
Gain a Level 3 Draven Talent and Parry from the Level 3 Watcher Talents.
You no longer Know any Basic Abilities.
<Traditionalist>.Name: <Traditionalist>

<Lich Ritual>.Requirement: Cleric, Mage or Warlock and Level 5
<Lich Ritual>.Effect:
You spend 24 hours in a special place of power (this could be a temple or given to you by your QM).
After it's finished, you become a Lich, and you are considered Undead.
Apply the following:
{Diamond} You can no longer cast Basic Abilities that don't cost Mana, but gain 2 extra Max Mana (or 1 if you're a Warlock). Passive Spells that don't cost Mana still apply.
{Diamond} You are Undead, thus immune to Fear and being put to Sleep
{Diamond} You no longer need to eat, drink or sleep.
{Diamond} You gain access to the Elemental and Eldritch Basic Ability Lists if you don't have them already
You also gain the Phylactery, Dismorphment and Death Pact Abilities.
<Lich Ritual>.Upgrade:
At Level 6, the range of all your Spells is doubled.
At Level 7, your Initiative increases by 4.
At Level 8, all your Checks increase by 1.
At Level 9, your Defense increases by 1.
At Level 10, your Max Health increases by 5.
<Lich Ritual>.Name: <Lich Ritual>

~Phylactery~.Effect:
When you become a Lich, you place your soul inside a Phylactery - a special object, dear to you.
When you would reach 0 Health, instead of going Fallen, you can instantly teleport your body inside the Phylactery.
A spellcaster can channel when resting inbetween Adventures to resummon you near the Phylactery with full Health, Spells, etc.
If the Phylactery is destroyed, you must wait 1 year to make another one.
~Phylactery~.Name: ~Phylactery~

~Dismorphment~.Effect:
When a Unit declares an attack or Spell on you, you can instantly teleport up to 3 meters away.
That Unit can keep their action or change it.
You can also instantly teleport using 0 Actions on your turn.
~Dismorphment~.Notes: Remember that at Level 6, the range of this becomes 6 as per the description of Cleric Lich Ritual.
~Dismorphment~.Name: ~Dismorphment~

~Death Pact~.Effect:
Choose an ally (or yourself).
They lose 5 Health. You gain 1 Mana this turn only.
~Death Pact~.Name: ~Death Pact~

~Killswitch Ambush~.Effect: Change your Specialization's Ambush to a different Ambush from another Specialization.
~Killswitch Ambush~.Upgrade: You can change it inbetween Adventures.
~Killswitch Ambush~.Notes:
For example, if you are a Thief and you don't like Backstabbing Ambush, switch it to Sudden Ambush from Assassin.
If a Talent further replaces Ambush, you can't change it unless you change the Talent inbetween Aventures.
~Killswitch Ambush~.Name: ~Killswitch Ambush~

<What Is A Spellbook>.Effect:
Your Known Spells no longer matter.
At the start of each Adventure and end of every Combat, roll 1d8. You instead know all Basic Abilities that correspond to what you rolled, within your Level.
<What Is A Spellbook>.Name: <What Is A Spellbook>

<Faithful Scripture>.Requirement: Paladin. Only usable in Worthy combat.
<Faithful Scripture>.Effect:
Choose an Ability you can currently cast with Faith Casting to store for later.
You can use it once any time until the end of the Adventure, but you can't use it otherwise until the end of the Adventure.
<Faithful Scripture>.Name: <Faithful Scripture>

<Deity From Beyond>.Effect: Choose a different Basic Ability School which will have its Spell's ^Dice Upgraded^ to the next die type (and it will no longer be the Divine Ability School).
<Deity From Beyond>.Name: <Deity From Beyond>

~MC - Cleric~.Effect: You gain the Awe, Spread the Awe, and Blessing Abilities from the Cleric Class, and access to the Divine Ability List.
~MC - Cleric~.Name: ~MC - Cleric~

~MC - Druid~.Cost: -1 in a Stat of choice, -2 Health Regen
~MC - Druid~.Effect:
You gain the Shapeshift and Druidcraft Abilities from the Druid and access to the Nature Ability List.
Instead of a Talent from your original Class, you can pick a Druid Specialization.
~MC - Druid~.Name: ~MC - Druid~

~MC - Hunter~.Effect: You gain the Animal Companion from the Hunter Class and access to either the Nature or the Warfare Ability List.
~MC - Hunter~.Name: ~MC - Hunter~

~MC - Mage~.Effect:
You gain the Magic Mastery and Learn Scrolls Abilities from the Mage and access to the Elemental and Arcane Ability Lists.
Instead of a Talent from your original Class, you can pick a Mage Specialization.
~MC - Mage~.Name: ~MC - Mage~

~MC - Paladin~.Cost: -3 and -1, each in a different Stat of choice
~MC - Paladin~.Effect:
You gain the Divine Sense and Holy Grace Abilities from the Paladin, and access to the Divine and Warfare Ability Lists.
Instead of a Talent from your original Class, you can pick a Paladin Specialization.
~MC - Paladin~.Name: ~MC - Paladin~

~MC - Rogue~.Effect:
You gain the Ambush and Hide Abilities from the Rogue, and access to the Bloodshed and Warfare Ability Lists.
Instead of a Talent from your original Class, you can pick a Rogue Specialization.
~MC - Rogue~.Name: ~MC - Rogue~

~MC - Shaman~.Effect:
You gain the Echoes and Mind Link Abilities from the Shaman Class, and access to either the Bloodshed, Nature or Mysticism Ability List.
Instead of a Talent from your original Class, you can pick a Shaman Specialization.
~MC - Shaman~.Name: ~MC - Shaman~

~MC - Warlock~.Cost: -1 in 3 Stats of choice, -1 Max Mana
~MC - Warlock~.Effect:
You gain access to one Basic Ability List of choice (through the Power Source Warlock Ability).
You also gain access to all starting Abilities from one Warlock Specialization.
~MC - Warlock~.Name: ~MC - Warlock~

~MC - Warrior~.Effect:
You gain the Advanced Flank and Charge Abilities and access to the Bloodshed and Warfare Ability Lists.
Instead of a Talent from your original Class, you can pick a Shaman Specialization.
~MC - Warrior~.Name: ~MC - Warrior~

~MR - Bertle~.Cost: -1 Max Health, -1 Max Health per Level
~MR - Bertle~.Effect: You gain all Bertle starting Abilities.
~MR - Bertle~.Notes: You are now also considered a Bertle.
~MR - Bertle~.Name: ~MR - Bertle~

~MR - Davel~.Effect: You gain all Davel starting Abilities.
~MR - Davel~.Notes: You are now also considered a Davel.
~MR - Davel~.Name: ~MR - Davel~

~MR - Dragonsworn~.Effect: You gain all Dragonsworn starting Abilities and one breath shape Ability.
~MR - Dragonsworn~.Notes: You are now also considered a Dwarf.
~MR - Dragonsworn~.Name: ~MR - Dragonsworn~

~MR - Dwarf~.Cost: -1 Max Health, -1 in a Stat of choice
~MR - Dwarf~.Notes: You are now also considered a Dwarf.
~MR - Dwarf~.Name: ~MR - Dwarf~

~MR - Elf~.Cost: -1 Max Health, -1 in a Stat of choice
~MR - Elf~.Notes: You are now also considered an Elf.
~MR - Elf~.Name: ~MR - Elf~

~MR - Gnome~.Cost: -1 Movement Speed, -2 Max Health and -1 Health Regen
~MR - Gnome~.Effect: You gain all Gnome starting Abilities. Congratulations!
~MR - Gnome~.Name: ~MR - Gnome~

~MR - Human~.Cost: -1 Max Health, -1 in a Stat of choice
~MR - Human~.Notes: You are now also considered a Human.
~MR - Human~.Name: ~MR - Human~

~MR - Orc~.Upgrade: Note that each Orc Talent costs -1 in a Stat of choice.
~MR - Orc~.Notes: You are now also considered a Orc.
~MR - Orc~.Name: ~MR - Orc~
